intro: Biscutella tergestina, commonly known as the Italian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are blue or violet, arranged in racemes, and bloom from spring to early summer. Biscutella tergestina is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands, where it thrives in sunny to partially shaded conditions.
